children.text: So, in s, if there's a 'b' followed by an 'a', they can swap to 'ba', moving the 'b' left. But once they are in 'ba' order, you can't swap them again. So in t, the 'a's must appear in the same relative order as in s, but their positions can be adjusted as long as the 'b's can be moved left.
children.label: mental_execution
